topic: UK from Margaret Thatcher to Brexit

questions.question: Who was Britain’s first woman Prime Minister?
questions.explanation: Margaret Thatcher became Britain’s first female Prime Minister in 1979.

questions.question: When did Margaret Thatcher become Prime Minister?
questions.explanation: Thatcher became Prime Minister after the 1979 General Election.

questions.question: Which industries declined during Thatcher’s government?
questions.explanation: Traditional industries such as shipbuilding and coal mining declined.

questions.question: What major economic policy did Thatcher’s government introduce?
questions.explanation: The government privatised many state-owned industries to reduce public control.

questions.question: Which war occurred in 1982 under Thatcher’s leadership?
questions.explanation: In 1982, Argentina invaded the Falkland Islands and Britain sent forces to recover them.

questions.question: Who succeeded Margaret Thatcher as Prime Minister?
questions.explanation: John Major followed Margaret Thatcher as Conservative Prime Minister.

questions.question: What peace process did John Major help establish?
questions.explanation: Major contributed to the early stages of the Northern Ireland peace process.

questions.question: When was the Good Friday Agreement signed?
questions.explanation: The Good Friday Agreement was signed in 1998.

questions.question: Who was the Labour Prime Minister elected in 1997?
questions.explanation: Tony Blair led the Labour Party to victory in 1997.

questions.question: What devolved body gained law-making powers under Tony Blair?
questions.explanation: The Scottish Parliament gained substantial legislative powers under Blair’s government.

questions.question: When did Gordon Brown become Prime Minister?
questions.explanation: Gordon Brown became Prime Minister in 2007 after Tony Blair.

questions.question: When did British combat troops leave Iraq?
questions.explanation: British troops officially left Iraq in 2009.

questions.question: What international force did the UK join in Afghanistan?
questions.explanation: The UK participated in the UN-mandated International Security Assistance Force (ISAF).

questions.question: When did Afghanistan take full responsibility for its security?
questions.explanation: Afghanistan assumed full security control in 2014.

questions.question: When was the UK’s first coalition government since 1974 formed?
questions.explanation: A coalition between Conservatives and Liberal Democrats was formed in 2010.

questions.question: Who was Prime Minister during the 2010 coalition government?
questions.explanation: David Cameron became Prime Minister in 2010 leading the coalition.

questions.question: When was the Brexit referendum held?
questions.explanation: The referendum on EU membership was held on 23 June 2016.

questions.question: What percentage voted to leave the EU in the 2016 referendum?
questions.explanation: 51.9% of voters chose to leave the European Union.

questions.question: Who became Prime Minister after David Cameron?
questions.explanation: Theresa May succeeded David Cameron in July 2016.

questions.question: When did the UK formally leave the European Union?
questions.explanation: The UK formally exited the EU on 31 January 2020.

questions.question: Who succeeded Theresa May as Prime Minister?
questions.explanation: Boris Johnson became Prime Minister on 24 July 2019.
